comments.comment:
The fix for the problem required granting derbyClient.jar 2 additional set of permissions
1)Property read permission for user.dir since that's where the Junit test wants to have the client tracing done.
permission java.util.PropertyPermission "user.dir", "read";
2)Also, in order to read/write in user.dir directory, the client jar needs following additional permission
permission java.io.FilePermission "${user.dir}${/}-", "read,write";

I am attaching the svn diff as DERBY2302_PolicyFileChange_diff_v1.txt

The only file that changed is
java\testing\org\apache\derbyTesting\functionTests\util\derby_tests.policy

Please let me know if anyone has any comments on this change.

The comments you have in these Jira notes as to why these permissions are required would be very useful in the policy file.
Otherwise at somepoint in the future someone will have to figure out why such permissions are needed.

Also the fact that only policy files were changed seems to imply that DERBY-811 has been fixed, would require some checking to confirm though.
I have commited the policy file with comments in it (revision 504938). Next, I will verify if DERBY-811 has been fixed by this change.
